project.teaser: With aviation traffic reaching unprecedent levels, surveillance is a critical service for ensuring operations safety and for improving airspace and airport capacity to accommodate the increasing traffic forecast. ASTONISH objective is to develop new surveillance solutions to...
project.objective:
With aviation traffic reaching unprecedent levels, surveillance is a critical service for ensuring operations safety and for improving airspace and airport capacity to accommodate the increasing traffic forecast. ASTONISH objective is to develop new surveillance solutions to sustain the growth of the European aviation sector using innovative technologies, addressing the peculiar challenges of airborne and ground traffic management. ASTONISH consortium identified three critical solutions: ground-based systems for enroute and terminal areas surveillance, aircraft-based alternate surveillance (A-SUR) technology, and airport and aircraft-based surveillance sensing systems for ground operations.
ASTONISH will investigate the use of an LDACS-based passive multistatic radar system and a network of distributed active radar systems to increase safety and capacity of sectors not covered by primary or secondary surveillance services, while providing a robust backup solution for non-cooperative surveillance. These solutions are expected to be cost-effective and environmental-friendly, built on services offered by LDACS to deliver a fully integrated CNS solution.
A-SUR solution will leverage the Hyperconnected ATM concept to use existing and potential new datalink channels such SATCOM, LDACS, VDLM2, 5G and LTE as alternative means for downlinking aircraft surveillance data. The objective is to relieve the congestion on the 1030 MHz and 1090 MHz frequencies used by SSR, ADS-B, and TCAS, offering a secure and robust solution for cooperative surveillance with limited impact on surveillance infrastructures and avionics systems.
ASTONISH solution for improving aircraft safety during ground operation will investigate new sensing systems such as lidars, radars, and vision-based sensor at aircraft and airport level, improving ground operation safety and airport resilience by increasing the situational awareness of the pilots and air traffic controllers under all-weather conditions.
project.title: Alternate Surveillance Technologies fOr iNnovatIve Solutions
project.keywords: Surveillance, CNS rationalisation, non-cooperative surveillance, LDACS, passive multistatic radar, radar, avionics architectures, aircraft protection on ground, cameras, lidar, sensor fusion, iCNS

result.title: Economic Evaluation (ECO- EVAL) for alternate surveillance for ATM operations
result.description: High level estimation of the costs associated with the concepts proposed by the alternate surveillance for ATM operations solution.

result.title: Functional Requirements Document (FRD) for improved aircraft protection on ground
result.description: Description of the high-level functional architecture and of the sensing technologies functional requirements.

result.title: Economic Evaluation (ECO- EVAL) for avionics architectures for alternate surveillance
result.description: Assessment of potential benefits of the avionics architectures for alternate surveillance solution with regards to a high level estimation of its costs.

result.title: Operational Service and Environment Description (OSED) for avionics architectures for alternate surveillance
result.description: Description of the use-case scenario related the operation of the avionic system for alternate surveillance.

result.title: Operational Service and Environment Description (OSED) for alternate surveillance for ATM operations
result.description: System concept definition, ATM operational performance requirements investigation, and user scenario definition for the alternate surveillance for ATM operations.

result.title: Operational Service and Environment Description (OSED) for improved aircraft protection on ground
result.description: Description of the airport environment for what concerns surface operation, definition of performance requirements and user scenarios.

result.title: Initial Communication, Dissemination and Exploitation (CDE) Plan
result.description: It aims at defining and raising the visibility of the project both within and outside the Consortium, in order to obtain the largest impact on the relevant stakeholders, and exploit project results.

result.title: Alternative Surveillance Technologies for Innovative Solutions in Air Traffic Management: The Astonish Project

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

category.title: HORIZON JU Research and Innovation Actions
